pull.title: [0.20] Fix GBT: Restore "!segwit" and "csv" to "rules" key
pull.body:
Original branch merges cleanly (no rebase needed)

See also #17946

events.message:
Bugfix: Include "csv","!segwit" in "rules"

They have been missing since buried deployments were merged
QA: feature_segwit: Check that template "rules" includes "!segwit" as appropriate

events.body: These commits are missing the `Github-Pull` and `Rebased-From` metadata that we normally add  to backports.
The commit were written before the branch (and are located on top of a common ancestor of master+0.20) , so I think the script doesn't need the metadata.
@fanquake This isn't a backport per se; it's the original branch, exactly the same commits just merged into master.

Appveyor is failing a test because the [commit](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17931) that fixed the error isn't included in this branch.

This commit is included in the ```0.20``` branch.

All tests passed on my local machine when git cherry-picked the commit to this branch.
This is a two-line code fix with a two-line test. The risk of breaking something is low, so I think this can go into final without another rc. Thoughts?

I would strongly prefer not to include any code change (no matter how minor) to the binaries in -final that is not in any rc.
As this is not a regression in 0.20, I think this can wait until 0.20.1.
(unless, of course, there happens to be need another rc for 0.20.0 then it can go in anyway)

issue.title: [0.19] Fix GBT: Restore "!segwit" and "csv" to "rules" key
issue.body:
Identical backport to #19019 (same commit).
Backported because 0328dcd is also in 0.19.

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.20.1
issue.body:
Updates the codebase to Bitcoin 0.20.1 which includes the following merges from Bitcoin.

doc: Update 0.20.1 release notes with psbt changes - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19636
0.20: Add txids with non-standard inputs to reject filter - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19680
[Backport] #19839 and #19842 to v0.20 - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20008
[0.20] lint: fix shellcheck URL in CI install - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19612
doc: move-only release notes for 0.20.1 - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19482
psbt: Increment input value sum only once per UTXO in decodepsbt - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19517
[0.20] Fix GBT: Restore "!segwit" and "csv" to "rules" key - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19019
[0.20] Add missing QPainterPath include - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19170
[0.20] Backports - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19224

Also includes a commit to restore 0.20 behaviour that was reverted during the initial 0.20 port for backwards compatibility related to the marker cache, this was included here due to compilation errors with the other changes in this PR. The change moves the call that removes TXs from the marker cache.

Move marker cache removal to be consistent with 0.20 - https://github.com/OmniLayer/omnicore/commit/eb360406c3491f948656a6c9dcf6bf47f56869ee
